title: TINY TRACTOR TINY FARM: JOHN DEERE 1025R IS KILLIN' IT!

tasks.task: Driving a tractor and using farm equipment
subtasks: Navigating through a farm property
Operating a box blade (tilling/digging)
Managing uneven terrain while operating equipment
Attacking shrubs and bushes with a stump bucket and tooth bar
Using a brush crusher for debris management
Handling honeybee risk and protective clothing
Considering alternative tools (chainsaw) but proceeding without
Moving dirt and creating berms
Overcoming variably rooted bushes and trees
Utilizing a stipula standstill for stability
Discussing potential payment in honey or eggs
Demonstrating interchangeable hydraulic tools and attachments
Addressing safety concerns with wildlife (coyotes, killer rooster)
Preparing garden plots with a box blade and shank teeth
Adjusting the box blade with weights for additional weight
Feathering and adjusting the box blade over uneven surfaces
Assessing tilling results for gardening readiness
Cutting shrubs near the house with manual methods
Controlling branches that may hit the house
Extracting roots and buried shrub parts with a stump bucket
Removing timber and soil around difficult roots

tasks.task: Managing on-farm bee colonies and protective measures
subtasks: Working around a beehive and using protective clothing
Navigating bee activity during landscaping tasks
Promoting and demonstrating Bora wheel spacers for tractor stability
Encouraging viewers to check website and social media for more information
Using discount codes for product purchases
Soliciting thumbs-ups and subscriptions from viewers
Promoting website and other channels
Interacting with viewers' comments and questions
Connecting hydraulic functions on a tractor (e.g., brush crusher, stump bucket)
Adjusting hydraulic systems for different attachments
Ensuring proper operation of third-function hydraulics
Maintaining continuity and enthusiasm during multiple days of filming
Addressing varied viewer concerns and requests
Maneuvering around farm structures (barns, fences)
Clearing pathways for agricultural equipment
Working around animal habitats and gates
